history.content:
I actually thought cs70 was easier than cs61b--cs70 over the school year you basically just do one problem set a week as opposed to 61b which has constant coding assignments and a lot of time consuming work.


—


I’m taking 61b, 70, and stat 134 right now. I’d say 61b is the highest workload of the 3 (I’m faster at psets than I am at coding), but it’s also the easiest. The content of 134 is more involved than 70’s but so far they’ve only tested fairly straightforward applications, whereas 70’s tests and homeworks make you think more creatively. 


I think you’d do fine with either class, but 70 might be easier for you because the second half overlaps almost completely with the first half of 134.

I actually thought cs70 was easier than cs61b--cs70 over the school year you basically just do one problem set a week as opposed to 61b which has constant coding assignments and a lot of time consuming work.

I am a freshman and I took stat 134, got a A- in my first semester. I am now taking CS61A, will perhaps get a A or A-. 

During the summer, I wish to take one CS class and one economics class. It sounds pretty difficult to manage so I am worried. As a result I wonder could anybody give me some ideas of which one will have heavier workload (and how much heavier)—61BL or 70—given that I have taken stat134 and 61A.
history.subject: Which one will be more difficult, CS 61BL or CS70 given I have taken 61A and Stat134
